Title: Risk management of electronic money (e-Money) using octave allegro methodology: Case study Pt. XYZ
Source title: Far East Journal of Electronics and Communications
Affiliations: Doctoral Program in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No-9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Magister Management Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No-9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gaol, F.L., Doctoral Program in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No-9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Supangkat, T., Magister Management Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No-9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to make a risk assessment aimed at to help the company chosen before knowing the kind of risks to occur. This study uses OCTAVE (Operationally Critical Threat, Asset, and Vulnerability Evaluation) Allegro Methodology to identify and evaluate information security risks. The respondents considered are Head of IT, Manager IT Research and Development, and Manager IT Operation. The results obtained include: (1) there are 10 critical asset information in e-money operation system in PT. XYZ, and (2) there are 52 risks that may occur during the operations of e-money. © 2017 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.
Author Keywords: Operational risk of e-money; Risk control; Risk management
